intro: Cyclopogon gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's cyclopogon, is a rare flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its unique, slender trunk and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish-white flowers, which are typically pollinated by insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
